::: {.cell}

:::

::: {.cell}

:::


The current valid map is identified by **Map code and version**: T7.3.web.alt v2.0.


> Major occurrences of plantations were taken from the map of Habitat type 14.3 by Jung et al. (2020) based on the IUCN Habitats Classification Scheme v3.1 (IUCN 2012). We compared this to cropping areas in consensus land-cover maps (Tuanmu et al., 2014) and found that maps of Jung et al. (2020) more closely matched the concept of T7.3..

::: {.cell}

:::


You can download and use this file from the following sources:

- Zenodo repository (bundle of maps) ([Includes GeoTIFF, GeoJSON and PNG versions in compressed file](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419))
 - Zenodo repository (EFG map) ([Includes GeoTIFF, GeoJSON and PNG files](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5091083))
 - Mapbox tileset ([GeoTIFF version uploaded to Mapbox](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.T7_3_web_alt))

::: {.cell}

:::

This section provides information about the valid indicative distribution map for the ecosystem functional group [**T7.3 Plantations**](/efg-info/T7_3.qmd).


::: {.cell}

:::

## Available maps

These maps are considered current and valid indicative distribution maps for this ecosystem functional group.

- Web navigation (**code: T7.3.web.alt**, version v2.0) 
 - Indicative Map (**code: T7.3.IM.alt**, version v2.0) 

## Map files

You can download geospatial data for this map from the following sources:

T7.3.web.alt (v2.0){target="gisdata"}: [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/T7.3.web.alt_v2.0.tif) :: [Zenodo repository (bundle of maps)](http://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5090419) :: [Zenodo repository (EFG map)](https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.5091083) :: [Mapbox tileset](https://studio.mapbox.com/tilesets/jrfep.T7_3_web_alt) :: [Earth Engine assets](projects/earthengine-legacy/assets/users/jrferrerparis/IUCN-GET/L3_IndMaps/)
T7.3.IM.alt (v2.0){target="gisdata"}: [Google Cloud bucket](gs://iucn_get_l3_im/T7.3.IM.alt_v2.0.tif)

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.
